page.title: 04 HOLMLEY LANE
page.content: Holmley Lane is the last line of development in this part of northern Derbyshire.The path of the road lies halfway down a steep slope and from it, the land continues to drop away and then flatter out northwards towards Sheffield. In this directoin the land cover is grassland for a few farms and a piggery. The houses are older semi_detached private housing.A large old house with some more moderm buildings behind set amongst the housing is a hospital for handicapped people.There are only a few shops close in the nearby village of Coal Aston but a bus service runs into Sheffield.There is a doctor's surgery, pub and Infant School,near which is a children's playgroud.There are a few allotments for older people.
